[{"id":"JT-46957","entityId":"25-1968642","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"46957"},{"name":"summary","value":"Agile Boards: completion menu is closed in a moment I want to use it in query field"},{"name":"description","value":"
JetBrains Bug & Issue Tracker YouTrack 2018.1
Build 41107 20 Apr 2018 00:00

I want to create new query for backlog in Agile Board settings. When I type my query completion is shown. But when I stop to select an option from completion it's closed. To open it I have to hit ctrl+space. See the video in attachment.

Predefined column is not removed in settings UI on remove action"},{"name":"description","value":"
JetBrains Bug & Issue Tracker YouTrack 2018.1
Build 41107 20 Apr 2018 00:00

  • Agile Boards -> Create -> Board -> Kanban board => In settings I define name, select one project and create new search for backlog => the board is created
  • Open Settings -> Columns and Rows tab -> 4 predefined columns (identified by state) are presented: Open, In Progress, Fixed, Verified
  • I don't need Verified column so I click on 'x' => nothing happen, the column definition is still here. I also able to select 'Verified' option in 'Merge with' menu of other columns
  • Click remove icon again => "Entity with id xxx-xxx not found" error is displayed:

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1524213881988,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":"jetbrains-team","markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"JT-20411","entityId":"25-572786","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"20411"},{"name":"summary","value":"Add ability to Duplicate Project"},{"name":"description","value":"
We have a small team in our company who are using as few fields as possible for their project, they've got their own bundles and their own fields.

I've just been approached to create them a new project in YouTrack, and they want the exact same setup, just with a different name, id and with no issues created within it.
I can't currently see a way to help them with this, so I've simply created a basic one, and will allow them to then sort out their own project to create a replicated one.

It'd be nice if I could browse to a project, and simply click 'Duplicate Project' to create a brand new one.

I too would love to see this! My team has expanded the states beyond the defaults, and added additional agile dashboards showing different views of the user stories and tasks based on the role of the viewer. Sadly, this means that adding a new project is not trivial, and therefore difficult to train others how to set one up properly.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1489431594742,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2350734","author":"condor616","authorFullName":"Giovanna Basile","issueId":"JT-20411","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1501833589366,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2438247","author":"diaphanous1138","authorFullName":"Ken Hopper","issueId":"JT-20411","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
I would love to see this as well. Would make things much easier for testing out changes to workflow locally without affecting the "live" project.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1506345512979,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2474613","author":"osboo","authorFullName":"Valentin","issueId":"JT-20411","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
hi Maksim Ryzhikov,
This feature is definitely must have for companies where Yourtack is candidate to become corporate standard (like it is intented in my one). When we try to push new teams into Youtrack-based workflows (rather than tracking issues in emails) the main stop factor is that we cannot setup projects for each group with same settings and workflow in limited time window. So they just say that it is not worth to learn how to configure it aligning with policy i.e. PMs will not invest their time in tuning the Youtrack. Then they use emails.
So if you want to expand your client base it is real high priority thing.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1507712169433,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2689561","author":"topvintage","authorFullName":"Angelique Van den Born","issueId":"JT-20411","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

This would be a most helpfull feature: we've several (SCRUM) project, each of which has the same settings. Whenever I have to add a new project, I would like to pick a previous project as a 'template' for the new one.

Alternatively, I would love to have a separate 'Template' project, whereby making changes to the Template project automatically updates the settings of all projects based on the Template Project.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1517391410141,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2801502","author":"andreasklinger","authorFullName":"Andreas","issueId":"JT-20411","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

My company is currently evaluating YouTrack, and this (or JT-18578) is a huge painpoint. So we would like to add our voice to vote for this feature.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1523005908686,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2828629","author":"simonfloris","authorFullName":"Simon Rauterberg","issueId":"JT-20411","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

I'd like to vote for this feature as well, as I see, there is no way to make a custom fieldset and kanban stages as a default. This means there are a lot of repeated boilerplate actions necessary, especially for a company with many projects per year, e.g. a web agency.

Build 40736
1. Goto Reports page
2. Select any report, press F2
3. Press "Esc"
AR: Nothing will happen

In Kotlin we have a 'Subsystem' field with something like 60 items.
With the old issue view (which seems to be active on "Create issue" page) I am able to see 27 items on my screen, everything is loaded at once.
With the new issue view:
  • only 9 items are shown;
  • scrolling down seems to load items from the server;
The need to wait for the server to scroll/search one of the most used fields really makes me sad, especially when I use the old issue view where everything worked just fine. Is it possible to return the old behaviour or at least to customize a number of initially loaded items for some fields?

STR:

  • render ng-select with ng-model and config attributes
  • select item
  • change config
  • Open select's dropdown again

ER: One selected item
AR: No selected items

Solution:
Remove line "selected: ctrl.convertNgModelToSelect(ctrl.ngModel)" from $onInit method.

        ctrl.config = angular.extend({}, {
          selected: ctrl.convertNgModelToSelect(ctrl.ngModel),

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1521615990554,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"JT-32921","entityId":"25-1073079","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"32921"},{"name":"summary","value":"Turn a selection of issues into a filter"},{"name":"description","value":"
In an issue list, I would like to select some issues using the checkboxes, and to create a filter from this selection in one click.

I could of course write the filter myself, like "#JT-19, #JT-56, #JT-99", but it is easier to select the issues graphically. Another alternative would be to create a dedicated tag, to apply it to the issues and to filter on this tag, but it is cumbersome to clean up these tags afterwards.

My motivation is to have a synthetic view of some loosely related issues, that I could visualize in an issue list in compact view mode.

Since most projects we're creating in youtrack have a few common features and tasks, it would be nice to be able to define project templates. Here's an example of the default tasks for a project:

Sprint 1
Analisys[Feature]
Check this[Task]
Verify that[Task]
...
Create backlog[Feature]
Create features[Task]
Detail tasks[Task]
Define sprints[Task]
...
Create tests[Feature]
Test 1[Task]
Test 2[Task]
Test 3[Task]
...
Development[Sprint]
...

Deployment[Sprint]
Prepare deployment[Feature]
Generate this
Generate that
...
Deployment verification[Feature]
Verify this
Verify that
...
...

So this would be the basis for all our projects and would be automatically set when the project is created from a template. Then we would fill in the specific stuff for the project. Is there a way to do this?


Thanx

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1475740735584,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2713106","author":"dafydd.henke-reed@abilitynet.org.uk","authorFullName":"Dafydd","issueId":"JT-18578","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
As commented in my issue (https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/JT-45208), this would be a huge win for our use of YouTrack. We have bespoke testing solutions. Let's call them:

test solution 1,
test solution 2,
test solution 3,
test solution 4.


They have shared and unique custom fields. One solution uses a set of fields. Another solution uses a slightly different set. When creating a project, we currently have to manually select which fields we want for the project. We can auto-attach fields that are used universally.

This would be much more useful than having Project Type: Default, Scrum, etc. If we instead had:

test solution 1 (auto-attached the fields for that project type).


You could administer this on the Custom Fields menu. Instead of auto-attach being a binary ON / OFF. You could have Auto-attach: all, create profile. And once you have created profile(s). Auto-attach: all, profile 1, 2, etc.
